availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Clay Bowman (Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of William Bowman. Married to Sallie Bowman. Father of Annabelle Bowman, Lucy Bowman, Sallie Bowman, and Henry Bowman. Married to Elizabeth Bowman. Father to Willie Bowman and Robert Lee Bowman. Farmer in Fayette County in 1850. Owned nine enslaved individuals in Fayette County in 1850. Farmer in Fayette County in 1860. Owner twenty-six enslaved individuals in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 163B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 287.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States_ (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 427B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Precinct 5, p. 114A.
"End Came Suddenly," Lexington Leader (Lexington, Ky.) January 25, 1903, p. 4.
"Henry Clay Bowman (1822-1903)," Find A Grave, Memorial #43237606, accessed June 24, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43237606.
